solution: Sol.131.(d) Election to the Panchayats. Panchayati Raj is a three-tiered administrative framework in India that focuses on rural development. The Panchayati Raj is a system of local self-government that is used to build districts, zones, and villages . Article - 243E: Duration of Panchayats. Article - 243D : Reservation of seats in Panchayat Article - 243F: Grounds of disqualification from membership of Panchayat.

question: Q.132. Article 72 of the Indian constitution is related with the power of the ______to grant pardons, etc. and to suspend, remit or commute sentences in certain cases. SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Chief Minister ', '(b) Governor ', '(c) President ', '(d) Prime Minister ']
solution: Sol.132.(c) President. This pardoning power of the President is independent of the Judiciary. Article-52: There shall be a President of India. Article-60: Oath or affirmation by the President. Article 111 - Assent to bills. Article 123- Ordinance making power of the president. Emergency powers of the President: (three types) National Emergency (Article 352), President's Rule (Article 356), Financial Emergency (Article 360).

question: Q.133. Article 350A of the Indian constitution is related with______. SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Special officers for linguistic minorities ', '(b) Facilities for instruction in mother-tongue at primary stage ', '(c) Direction for development of the Hindi language ', '(d) Language to` be used in Supreme Court and High Courts of India ']
answer: (b) Facilities for instruction in mother-tongue at primary stage
solution: Sol.133.(b) Article - 350 : Language to be used in representations for redress of grievances. Article - 350B: Special Officer for linguistic minorities. Article- 351: Directive for development of the Hindi language. Article 348 (1)(a): All proceedings in the Supreme Court and in every High Court, shall be in English language.

question: Q.134. Which Article of the Indian constitution is related with the special provision with respect to the States of Maharashtra and Gujarat? SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Article 371 ', '(b) Article 386 ', '(c) Article 377 ', '(d) Article 380 ']
solution: Sol.134.(a) Article 371.

question: Q.135. Which part o f the Constitution of India consists of the idea of a Welfare State? SSC CGL Tier II (02/03/2023)
options: ['(a) Directive Principles of State Policy ', '(b) Fundamental Duties ', '(c) Fundamental Rights ', '(d) Preamble ']
solution: Sol.135.(a) Directive Principles of State Policy is mentioned in Part IV, Article 36–51. Article 38 gives the idea of a Welfare State. The directive principles of state policy are borrowed from Ireland. Fundamental Duties (Part IV A, Article 51A). Fundamental Rights (Part III, Article 12-35). A preamble is an introductory statement in a document that explains the document's philosophy and objectives.

question: Q.136. Article 148 of the Constitution of India provides for an independent office of the ________. SSC CGL Tier II (06/03/2023)
options: ['(a) Attorney General of India ', '(b) President of India ', '(c) Comptroller and Auditor General of Indi ', '(d) Advocate General of the State ']
answer: (c) Comptroller and Auditor General of Indi
solution: Sol.136.(c) Comptroller and Auditor General of India (Article 148) : Head of the Indian Audit and Accounts Department and bulwarks of the democratic system of government in India. Attorney General of India (Article 76) : Highest law officer of India. Advocate General of State (Article 165) : Highest law officer of State.

question: Q.137. How many types of writs can be issued under Article 32 and 226 of the Constitution of India ? SSC CGL Tier II (06/03/2023)
options: ['(a) Four ', '(b) Six ', '(c) Five ', '(d) Seven ']
solution: Sol.137.(c) Five . Articles 32 (Heart and Soul of Indian Constitution) - Supreme Court has the authority to issue writs and Article 226 - High Court has the authority to issue a writ. Writs - Habeas corpus (to have the body of), Mandamus (We Command), Prohibition (to forbid), Certiorari (to be certified or to be informed) and Quo-warranto (By what authority or warrant).

question: Q.138. Which Article of the Constitution does India mention that business in Parliament shall be transacted in Hindi or English? SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Article 120 ', '(b) Article 121 ', '(c) Article 122 ', '(d) Article 119 ']
solution: Sol.138.(a) Article 120 . Article 121 - Restriction on discussion in Parliament. Article 122 - Courts not to inquire into proceedings of Parliament. Article 119 - Regulation by law of procedure in Parliament in relation to financial business.

question: Q.139. Which Article of Indian constitution is related with the Special provisions with respect to the State of Sikkim? SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Article 371C ', '(b) Article 371 ', '(c) Article 371F ', '(d) Article 371A ']
solution: Sol.139.(c) 371 F - Sikkim (36th Amendment Act, 1975). Article 371 of the Constitution includes special provisions for 11 states (6 states of the Northeast). Article 371 - provisions for Maharashtra and Gujarat. Article 371 A - Nagaland (13 t h Amendment Act, 1962). 371 B - Assam (22 n d Amendment Act, 1969). 371 C - Manipur ( 27 t h Amendment Act, 1971). 371 D - Andhra Pradesh and Telangana (32 n d. Amendment Act, 1973). 371 E - To establish Central University in Andhra Pradesh. 371 G - Mizoram (53 r d. Amendment Act, 1986). 371 H - Arunachal P radesh (55 t h Amendment Act, 1986). 371 I - Goa.

question: Q.140. Under which Article of the Constitution of India is the National Commission for Scheduled Castes established? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Article 336 ', '(b) Article 338 ', '(c) Article 333 ', '(d) Article 335 ']
solution: Sol.140.(b) Article 338. By 89th Amendment, 2003 the erstwhile National Commission for SC and ST was r eplaced by two separate Commissions from the year 2004 : National Commission f or Scheduled Castes (NCSC) (Article - 338) and National Commission for Scheduled Tribes (NCST) (Article 338-A).

question: Q.141. Which Part of the Indian Constitution is known a s ‘Magna Carta of India’ ? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Part III ', '(b) Part II ', '(c) Part VI ', '(d) Part IV ']
solution: Sol.141.(a) Part III ( T he Fundamental Rights, Articles 12-35). ‘Magna Carta’, the Charter of Rights issued by King John of England in 1215 was the first written document relating to the Fundamental R ights of citizens.

question: Q.142. Which Article of the Constitution of India provides for the power to the President to convene a joint sitting of both the Houses of Parliament? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Article 331 ', '(b) Article 105 ', '(c) Article 108 ', '(d) Article 85 ']
solution: Sol.142.(c) Article 108. Article 105 - Powers, privileges, etc. o f P arliament and its members.

question: Q.143. Which Article of the Constitution of India deals with the Conduct of Business of the Government of a State? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Article 165 ', '(b) Article 163 ', '(c) Article 166 ', '(d) Article 164 ']
solution: Sol.143.(c) Article-166. Article-163 (Council of Ministers to aid and advise Governor), Article-164 (Other provisions as to Ministers), Article-165 (Advocate - General for the State).

question: Q.144. Which Article of the Constitution of India deals with the appointment of ad-hoc judges? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Article 126 ', '(b) Article 127 ', '(c) Article 128 ', '(d) Article 125 ']
solution: Sol.144.(b) Article 127. Article 125: talks about the financial privileges and allowances that are defined for the judges of t he Supreme Court. Article 126: Appointment of acting Chief Justice of India. Article 128: Attendance of retired judges at sitting of the Supreme Court.

question: Q.145. Which Article of the Constitution of India deals with the Sessions of the Parliament? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Article 85 ', '(b) Article 89 ', '(c) Article 90 ', '(d) Article 101 ']
solution: Sol.145.(a) Article 85 - Sessions of Parliament, prorogation, and dissolution. A session is a period during which a House meets almost every day uninterruptedly to manage the business. Article 90 - Vacation and resignation of (and removal from) the office of Deputy Chairman. Article 101- Vacation of seats in Parliament.

question: Q.146. Which chapter of the Constitution of India, discusses the Articles of Parliament ? SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Chapter III ', '(b) Chapter I ', '(c) Chapter II ', '(d) Chapter IV ']
solution: Sol.146.(c) Chapter II (79-122) . Part V - The Union of Indian Constitution Chapter II deals with the Articles of Parliament . Chapter I (The Executive; Articles 52 to 78); Chapter III: Legislative powers of t he President; Article 123); Chapter IV (The Union Judiciary; Articles 124 - 147). Chapter V (Comptroller and Auditor - General of India (CAG); Articles 148 to 151).

question: Q.147. The Article of the Indian Constitution that deals with all the executive powers of the Governor is ____ SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Article 150 ', '(b) Article 157 ', '(c) Article 154 ', '(d) Article 156 ']
solution: Sol.147.(c) Article 154- Executive power of Governor. Article 150 - Form of accounts of the Union and of the States. Article 157 - Qualifications for appointment as Governor. Article 156 - Term of office of Governor.

question: Q.148. Which Part of the Indian Constitution provides for the Union Public Service Commission? SSC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Part X ', '(b) Part VIII ', '(c) Part XIV ', '(d) Part XVI ']
solution: Sol.148.(c) Part XIV. Union Public Service Commission (UPSC ) is an independent constitutional body. The provisions regarding the composition of UPSC, the appointment, and removal of its members, and the powers and functions of UPSC are provided in Part XIV of the Indian Constitution under Article 315 to Article 323. PART X: The Scheduled and Tribal areas. PART XVI: Special Provisions relating to certain classes. PART VIII: The Union Territories.

question: Q.149. Which Articles of the Indian Constitution deal with the Union Executive ? S SC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Articles 38 to 50 ', '(b) Articles 52 to 78 ', '(c) Articles 80 to 86 ', '(d) Articles 112 to 118 ']
solution: Sol.149.(b) Article 52 to 78 (Part V) . Articles 80 to 86 (Part V) deals with the general provisions of the Union Parliament. Articles 112 to 118 (Part V) deal with the legislative procedures of the Union Parliament.

question: Q.150. Who termed Article 32 as the ‘heart and soul of the Constitution of India’? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) MV Pylee ', '(b) BR Ambedkar ', '(c) Jawaharlal Nehru ', '(d) Sachchidananda Sinha ']
solution: Sol.150.(b) B.R. Ambedkar . Article 32 empowers Parliament to authorise any other court to issue these writs.

question: Q.151. Which Article of the Indian Constitution states that “Supreme Court to be a court of Record”? SSC CHSL 25/05/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Article 135 ', '(b) Article 126 ', '(c) Article 129 ', '(d) Article 131 ']

question: Q.173. Which of the following states is included in the sixth schedule of the Constitution of India? SSC CHSL 17/03/2020 (Morning)

question: Q.178. In which year did the 44th Amendment remove the right to property from the list of fundamental rights? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.178.(a) 1978. The right to property was listed under Article 31 before its deletion. At present the right to property is listed under Article 300A as a legal right.

question: Q.179. Which among the following is INCORRECT about the salient features o f the 73rd Amendment Act ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) The Act corresponds to Part III of the Constitution of India. ', '(b) The Act gives a Constitutional status to the Panchayati Raj Institutions. ', '(c) The Act has added the Eleventh Schedule to the Constitution of India. ', '(d) It contains 29 functional items of the Panchayats and deals with Article 243 to 243(O). ']
answer: (a) The Act corresponds to Part III of the Constitution of India.
solution: Sol.179.(a) Part III (Article 12 to 35) - It contains the provision regarding Fundamental Rights. The 73rd Amendment Act - It was e nacted in 1992 and came into force from April 1993. question: Q.180. How many types of the amendment are mentioned by the Indian Constitution as per Article 368 ? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Four ', '(b) Two ', '(c) Five ', '(d) Three ']
solution: Sol.180.(b) Two. A rticle 368 (Part XX) - Power of parliament to amend the constitution and its procedures. Two types of amendments: The special Majority, and special majority of parliament along with the ratification of half of t he state's legislatures by a simple majority. The procedure of amending the constitution has been adopted from the constitution of South Africa.

question: Q.181. Which of the following fundamental duties was added to the Indian Constitution by the 86 th Constitutional Amendment Act, 2002? SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) To abide by the Constitution and respect its ideals and institutions, the National Flag and the National Anthem ', '(b) To protect and to improve the natural environment including forests, lakes, rivers and wildlife, and to have compassion for living creatures ', '(c) To provide opportunities for education to his/her child or, as the case may be, ward between the age of six and fourteen years ', '(d) To cherish and follow the noble ideals which inspired our national struggle for freedom ']
answer: (c) To provide opportunities for education to his/her child or, as the case may be, ward between the age of six and fourteen years
solution: Sol.181.(c) Fundamental Duties (Article 51-A): These were incorporated in Part IV-A of the Constitution by the 42 nd Constitutional Amendment Act, 1976 on the recommendations of the Swaran Singh Committee. Originally 10 in number, 11th duty was added through the 86th Constitutional A mendment Act, 2002.

question: Q.182. The Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, which provides for the more effective prevention of certain unlawful activities of individuals and associations dealing with terrorist activities, was first put i nto effect in India in the year. SSC CHSL 04/08/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.182.(b) 1967. Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act - Its main objective is dealing with activities directed against the integrity and sovereignty of India. It assigns absolute power to the central government and provides for death penalty and life imprisonment of c ulprits. Related acts - Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) 1958; Prevention of Terrorism Act, 2002; The National Investigation Agency Act, 2008; The Anti-Hijacking Act, 2016.

question: Q.183. Which of the following principles was added by the 42nd Constitutional Amendment in the Indian Constitution? SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) The State shall provide free and compulsory education ', '(b) To organise agriculture and animal husbandry on modern and scientific lines ', '(c) To protect and improve the environment and to safeguard forests and wildlife ', "(d) Reservation of SC's and ST's in services "]
answer: (c) To protect and improve the environment and to safeguard forests and wildlife
solution: Sol.183.(c) 42nd Amendment Act,1976 (‘Mini Constitution’): Added three new words (socialist, secular and integrity) in the Preamble . Added three new Directive Principles (equal justice and free legal aid, the participation of workers in the management of i ndustries and protection o f the environment, forests, and wildlife). Part XIV-A - Articles 323A and 323B for Tribunals were added.

solution: Sol.186.(c) 2014. The States Reorganisation Act (1956), under the provisions of Part I (Article 3). question: Q.196. Which of the following statements are correct regarding the Supreme Court judgement o n validity of 103rd Constitutional Amendment Act? A. question: Q.199. W hich of the following Constitutional Amendments incorporated Dadra and Nagar Haveli in the Union of India as a Union Territory ? SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Afternoon)

Committee on Public Undertakings – 1964, Members-22 (15 from Lok Sabha and 7 from Rajya Sabha), Term of Office (One Year), Function – to examine the reports and accounts of the Public Sector Undertakings.

question: Q.260. Members of Public Accounts Committee are elected for a period of: SSC CHSL 25/05/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) one year ', '(b) two years ', '(c) five years ', '(d) three years ']
solution: Sol.260.(a) one year. The Committee on Public Accounts is the oldest Parliamentary Committee and was first constituted in 1921. The Speaker is empowered to appoint the Chairman of the Committee from amongst its Members.

question: Q.261. Which of the following persons was NOT a part of the Committee of Administrators (CoA) appointed by the Supreme Court of India in 2017, to oversee the implementation of t he Lodha reforms in the Board of Control for C ricket in India (BCCI)? SSC MTS 06/10/2021(Morning)
options: ['(a) Vinod Rai ', '(b) Mahim Verma ', '(c) Vikram Limaye ', '(d) Ramachandra Guha ']
solution: Sol.261.(b) Mahim Verma . The Supreme Court of India had appointed 4 eminent personalities - former CAG Vinod Rai, historian Ramachandra Guha, former India women's captain Diana Edulji and Vikram Limaye, managing director and CEO of IDFC (Infrastructure Development Finance Corporation).

question: Q.262. Which Commission recommended 27% reservation for O BC candidates in all levels of government services? SSC MTS 07/10/2021 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Sarkaria Commission ', '(b) Mandal Commission ', '(c) Balwant Commission ', '(d) Kothari Commission ']
solution: Sol.262.(b) The Mandal Commission (Second Backward Class Commission) recommended that members o f O BCs be given 27 percent reservations for jobs under the Central government and public sector undertakings. This commission was established in India in 1979 by the Janata Party government under Prime Minister Morarji Desai. It was headed by BP Mandal.

question: Q.263. In 1990, the Dinesh Goswami Committee was formed to make recommendations on: SSC MTS 20/10/2021 (Morning)
options: ['(a) centre-state relations ', '(b) police reforms ', '(c) electoral reforms ', '(d) fundamental duties ']
solution: Sol.263.(c) Electoral reforms . Dinesh Goswami Committee important recommendation - Elimination of misuse of official machinery, Public funding of elections, Strengthening of the Election Commission and securing its independence.

question: Q.264. Who among the following is NOT a part of the committee, which is constructed to provide suggestions to the Prime Minister regarding the appointment of a chief commissioner of the Central Information Commission? SSC CHSL 06/08/2021 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Speaker of the Lok Sabha. ', '(b) A Union Cabinet Minister appointed by the Prime Minister. ', '(c) Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha ', '(d) Prime Minister . ']
solution: Sol.264.(a) Speaker of the Lok Sabha. A chief commissioner of the Central Information Commission is appointed by the President on the recommendation of a committee consisting of the Prime Minister as Chairperson, the Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, and a Union Cabinet M inister nominated by the Prime Minister. Parliament

question: Q.265. The First hour of a sitting of the House allotted for asking and answering of questions is called as __________ . SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Censure motion ', '(b) Zero hour ', '(c) Privilege motion ', '(d) Question hour ']
solution: Sol.265.(d) Question hour. Censure motion - A motion to express disapproval of the conduct of the government or a minister. Zero hour - The first hour of a sitting of the House, when MPs can raise matters of urgent public importance without notice. Privilege motion - A motion to protect the privileges of the House or its members.

question: Q.266. A money bill under Article 111 of the Constitution of India, presented to the President for assent, has to be endorsed by a Certificate of the ________signed by him/her that it is a money bill. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Secretary General of the Lok Sabha ', '(b) Secretary General of the Rajya Sabha ', '(c) Speaker of the Lok Sabha ', '(d) Deputy Chairman of the Rajya Sabha ']
solution: Sol.266.(c) Speaker of the Lok Sabha. Articles related to Money Bill: Article 107 - Provisions as to introduction and passing of Bills. Article 108 - Joint sitting of both Houses in certain cases. Article 109 - Special procedure in respect of Money Bills. Article 110 - Definition of “Money Bills”. Article 197 - Restriction on powers of Legislative Council as to Bills other than Money Bills.

question: Q.267. After how many days of absence from Parliament without permission will a Member of Parliament be disqualified? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) 60 days ', '(b) 30 days ', '(c) 50 days ', '(d) 20 days ']
solution: Sol.267.(a) 60 days. Disqualifications of Members of parliament : Article 101 - Vacation of seats. Article 102 - Disqualifications for membership. A rticle 103 - Decision on questions as to disqualifications of m embers. A rticle 104 - Penalty for sitting and voting before making oath or affirmation under article 99 or when not qualified or when disqualified.

question: Q.268. What is the bicameral legislature of the Indian Constitution? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) It is a legislative body with four houses. ', '(b) It is a legislative body with two houses. ', '(c) It is a legislative body with one house. ', '(d) It is a legislative body with three houses. ']
answer: (b) It is a legislative body with two houses.
solution: Sol.268.(b) Bicameralism was first introduced in India by The Government of India Act of 1919. Article 80 of the Constitution lays down the maximum strength of Rajya Sabha (Upper House) as 250, out of which 12 members are nominated by the President and 238 are representatives of the States and of the three Union Territories.

question: Q.269. What is the most powerful weapon that enables the Parliament to ensure executive accountability? SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Approval or refusal of laws ', '(b) The no-confidence motion ', '(c) Confirmation of treaties ', '(d) Deliberation and discussion ']
solution: Sol.269.(b) The no-confidence motion. It moved in the Lok Sabha (and not in the Rajya Sabha) to test the confidence of the government. It needs the support of 50 members to be admitted. Other ways to ensure executive accountability: Question-hour, zero hour, calling attention motion, adjournment motion, censure motion, and other discussions.

question: Q.270. Which of the following is not a cabinet committee? SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Appointment Committee of the Cabinet ', '(b) Committee on Political Affairs ', '(c) Committee on Investment and Growth ', '(d) Committee on Conflicts among Ministers ']
solution: Sol.270.(d) Cabinet Committees are organisational devices to lessen the enormous workload of the cabinet. It is an extra-constitutional body. List of Cabinet Committees: Cabinet Committee on Accommodation, Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, Cabinet Committee on Parliamentary Affairs, Cabinet Committee on Security, Cabinet Committee on Employment and Skill Development. All committees except Cabinet Committee on Accommodation and Cabinet Committee on Parliamentary Affairs are headed by the Prime Minister.

question: Q.271. What is the maximum time gap between two sessions of the State Legislature ? SSC MTS 08/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Three months ', '(b) Two months ', '(c) Six months ', '(d) One year ']
solution: Sol.271.(c) Six months. Article 174 (1) - The Governor shall from time to time summon the House or each H ouse of t he State Legislature to meet at such time and place as he thinks fit. Article 85 (1) of the Constitution empowers the President to summon and prorogue either house of Parliament or to dissolve the Lok Sabha. Three types of Sessions in the Parliament of India: Budget session (February - May), Monsoon session (July - September) and Winter session (November - December) are held in a calendar year.

question: Q.272. Who was the first speaker of the Lok Sabha? SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) NS Reddy ', '(b) GV Mavalankar ', '(c) Ananthasayanam Ayyangar ', '(d) Mira Kumar ']
solution: Sol.272.(b) Ganesh Vasudev Mavalankar. Neelam Sanjiva Reddy - He served as the sixth president of India (1977-82). Ananthasayanam Ayyangar - First deputy speaker of Lok Sabha. Lok Sabha- Maximum strength : Fixed at 550 out of which 530 are to represent states and 20 to Union territories (UTs). Current strength of Lok sabha - 543. First female Lok sabha speaker :- Meira Kumar (15th Lok Sabha).

question: Q.273. When was the first general election for Lok Sabha held in India ? SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.273.(d) 1951-52. First Lok Sabha: Jawaharlal Nehru (Indian National Congress) became India’s first democratically elected Prime Minister. 17th Lok Sabha Election (2019): Narendra Modi (Bharatiya Janata Party) became Prime Minister. Lok Sabha Seat: 543 Parliamentary Constituencies (At present). First Panchayati Raj Election in India was held on 2nd of Oct 1959 in the Nagaur district of Rajasthan.

question: Q.274. How long can a person remain a minister without being a member of either House of the State Legislature? SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) 15 days ', '(b) 6 months ', '(c) 1 year ', '(d) 2 months ']
solution: Sol.274.(b) 6 months. Articles 163-164 deals with the Council of M inisters (CoM) in states. The articles 75 (5) and 164 (4) state that a minister who for any period of six consecutive months is not a member of either house of P arliament or state legislature respectively shall cease to be such minister at the expiration of that period.

question: Q.275. Which of the following pairs is/are correctly matched regarding the terminology used in the Parliament? A. Appropriation Bill - A Money Bill passed for providing for the withdrawal or appropriation from and out of the Consolidated Fund of India B. Demand for Grants - Earmarking of budgetary allocation for meeting only planned expenditure of a Ministry/Department C. Short Duration Discussion - For raising a discussion on a matter of u rgent public importance for which a notice has to be given by a Member and supported by 50 Members. SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) A, B and C ', '(b) B and C only ', '(c) A only ', '(d) A and C only ']
solution: Sol.275.(c) A only. Demand for Grants is the form in which estimates of expenditure from the Consolidated Fund (included in the annual financial statement and required to be voted upon in the Lok Sabha) are submitted in pursuance of Article 113 of the Constitution. Short Duration Discussion is a procedural device to enable members to raise discussion on matters of urgent public importance without a formal motion on a matter of urgent public importance. The Speaker can a llot two days in a week for such discussions.

question: Q.276. Which of the following can make provisions for Ancillary powers of the Supreme Court? SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) President of India ', '(b) Law Commission of India ', '(c) Minister of Law & Justice ', '(d) Parliament of India ']
solution: Sol.276.(d) Parliament o f India. A ncillary powers of the Supreme Court (Article 140): The Parliament, through legislation, can grant the Supreme Court additional powers that are in line with the Constitution's provisions. These extra powers should help the Court better fulfill its constitutional jurisdiction. President of India : Articles 52 - 62 (Part V), Parliament of I ndia : Articles 79-122 (Part V), Supreme Court : Articles 124-147 (Part V).

question: Q.277. In India, during a meeting of the Legislative Assembly or Council, if there is no quorum, it shall be the duty of the ________ to adjourn t he House or suspend the meeting. Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 (Shift - 3)
options: ['(a) Chairman/Governor ', '(b) Speaker/Chairman ', '(c) Governor/Chief Minister ', '(d) Speaker/Chief Minister ']
solution: Sol.277.(b) Speaker/Chairman. Article 100 - Voting in Houses, power of H ouses to act notwithstanding vacancies and quorum. Quorum - It refers to the number of members that must be present for a house meeting to take place. Article 189 (3) - The quorum to constitute a meeting of the state legislature shall be ten members or one-tenth of the total number of members of the house whichever is greater.

question: Q.278. Which of the following Articles of the Constitution of India lays down the maximum strength of t he Rajya S abha a s 250 ? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 4)
options: ['(a) Article 85 ', '(b) Article 80 ', '(c) Article 83 ', '(d) Article 81 ']
solution: Sol.278.(b) Article 80. Rajya Sabha consists of 238 members representing the States and Union Territories, and 12 members nominated by the President. Article 85 - Sessions of Parliament, prorogation and dissolution. Article 81 - Composition of the House of t he People. Article 83 - Duration of Houses of Parliament.

question: Q.279. At least how old must be an Indian citizen to be a member of Rajya Sabha? SSC MTS 08/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) 30 years ', '(b) 25 years ', '(c) 35 years ', '(d) 20 years ']
solution: Sol.279.(a) 30 years. Article 84 provides for the qualification of a member of the Parliament. Accordingly, He must be a citizen of I ndia. Minimum 25 years of a ge for Lok Sabha. Minimum age for the President and vice president is 35 years. There is no minimum age prescribed in the constitution for t he judge of s upreme court.

question: Q.280. The Legislative Council of a s tate comprises not more than ______ of the total number of members in the Legislative Assembly of the state. SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) two - third ', '(b) three - fourth ', '(c) one - third ', '(d) one - fifth ']
solution: Sol.280.(c) one-third . State Legislative Council size cannot be less than 40 members. Composition - A total of 5 /6 of the total number of members of a Legislative Council are indirectly elected (1/12 are elected by graduates of three years standing and residing within the state, 1/12 are elected by teachers of three years standing in the state, 1/3 are elected by the members o f t he legislative assembly of the state from amongst persons who are not members of the assembly, and 1/3 are elected by the members of local bodies) and the 1/6 are nominated by the Governor. The Chairman and Deputy Chairman are elected by the members of the Legislative Council among themselves. Article 171 - Composition of the Legislative Councils.

question: Q.281. A maximum of_________members can be nominated by the President of India to become a member of the Rajya Sabha. SSC MTS 16/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.281.(a) 12 Members Nominated by the President who has 'special knowledge or practical experience in literature, science, art and social service'. Rajya Sabha (The Council of States): Upper House. maximum strength - 250. Current strength - 245. Article 80 – Composition of the Council of States (Rajya Sabha). Article 84 - Qualification for membership of Parliament. Schedule IV - allocation of seats in the Rajya S abha to the states and UTs.

question: Q.282. A Money Bill should be returned to the Lok Sabha within ___ days by Rajya Sabha, either with recommendations or without recommendations. SSC MTS 19/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.282.(c) 14. Money Bill (Article 110) - It is involved with tax collection, public expense bills, and other significant costs associated with running the government. Money Bill Types - Financial Bill and Appropriation Bill. The Speaker has the authority to determine whether or not a specific bill is a money bill.

question: Q.283. Archana wishes to contest for Lok Sabha elections in India. What is the maximum limit of constituencies that can she contest? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) One ', '(b) Four ', '(c) Three ', '(d) Two ']
solution: Sol.283.(d) Two. Candidates were allowed to contest more than Two seats until 1996. As per, Section 33 (7) of the RPA (Representation of the People Act) 1951, one candidate can contest from a maximum of two constituencies. Section 70 bars candidates from representing two constituencies in the Lok Sabha/state, which means candidates have to vacate one seat in case of winning both the seats.

question: Q.284. What is the term of the State legislative assembly in India as per Indian constitution ? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) 3 years ', '(b) 5 years ', '(c) 4 years ', '(d) 7 years ']
solution: Sol.284.(b) 5 years. State Legislature (Article 168 - 212) comprises Legislative Assembly and Legislative Council. Article 170 - Composition of the Legislative Assemblies. Article 171 - Composition of the Legislative Councils.Legislative Council members are elected for a term of 6 years.

question: Q.285. The Lok Sabha (House of the People) was duly constituted for t he first time on _______ . SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.285.(b) 17 April 1952. The First Lok Sabha lasted for a full five years tenure and was dissolved on 4 April 1957. Article 79 of the Constitution deals with the Parliament consisting of the President, Lok Sabha, and Rajya Sabha. First Lok Sabha Speaker - GV Mavlankar.

question: Q.286. What is the tenure of a Rajya Sabha member? SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Five years ', '(b) Three years ', '(c) Six years ', '(d) Two years ']
solution: Sol.286.(c) Six years ( o ne third members retire after every two years). Article 80 - Composition of the Council of States. Rajya Sabha - constituted on 3 April 1952. Chairman (ex officio) - Vice President of India. Seats at present - 245 (233 Elected + 12 Nominated). Voting system - 238 members are elected by single transferable vote by state legislatures, 12 members are nominated by the President. Maximum Rajya Sabha seats - Uttar Pradesh (31). Q.287 . The term 'Parliament' refers to the_________ SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (1st Shift) (a) Rajya Sabha (b) Lok Sabha (c) State legislature (d) National legislature Sol.287.(d) National legislature . The Indian Parliament comprises the President and the two Houses - Rajya Sabha (Council of States) and Lok Sabha. The State Legislature is the legislative body of the state in India. It comprises the Legislative Assembly, the Legislative Council (in some cases), and the State Governor.

question: Q.288. Which of the following can alter the boundary of a state or change its name? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) State government ', '(b) Parliament ', '(c) Supreme Court ', '(d) High Court ']
solution: Sol.288.(b) Parliament. Article 3 states that the Parliament may by law form a new State by separation of a territory from any State or by uniting two or more States completely or in parts or by uniting any territory to a part of any State.

question: Q.289. Who runs the government at the national level under the parliamentary system? SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) The President and Council of Ministers ', '(b) The Prime Minister and Council of Ministers ', '(c) The Prime Minister ', '(d) The President ']
answer: (b) The Prime Minister and Council of Ministers
solution: Sol.289.(b) The Prime Minister and the Council of Ministers run the Parliamentary system (cabinet system or the Responsible government, Prime Minister Model) at the National level. Articles 74 and 75 (Part V) provide the parliamentary system for the centre. Article 163 and 164 (Part VI) provides the parliamentary system for the states.

question: Q.290. The Constitution provides for reservation of seats in the Lok Sabha and State Legislative Assemblies for the: SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) scheduled tribes ', '(b) other backward classes ', '(c) differently abled ', '(d) women ']
solution: Sol.290.(a) Scheduled tribes . Article 366(25) of the Constitution deals with Scheduled Tribes. There are over 705 tribes which have been notified. The largest number of tribal communities a re found in Odisha. Related Committees to Schedule tribes : Xaxa Committee (2013), Bhuria Commission (2002-2004), Lokur Committee (1965). The Fifth Schedule of the Constitution deals with Administration and Control of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes in states other than Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura and Mizoram. The Sixth Schedule deals with the administration of t he tribal areas in Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura and Mizoram.

question: Q.291. Which of the following is NOT a kind of question related to Indian Parliamentary Proceedings? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Starred Question ', '(b) Unstarred Question ', '(c) Short Notice Question ', '(d) Long Notice Question ']
solution: Sol.291.(d) Long Notice Question. Starred Questions are those for w hich a n oral answer is expected. Non-starred questions are those for which a written reply is expected. Short notice questions are those which are asked on matters of urgent public importance and can be asked on a shorter notice, less than 10 days.

question: Q.292. Which of the following is called 'the temple of the country's democracy'? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Raj Ghat ', '(b) Supreme Court ', '(c) Ashok Pillar ', '(d) Parliament ']
solution: Sol.292.(d) Parliament (Article 79) consists of the President (Article 52), Council of States (Article 80 - Rajya Sabha) and House of the People (Article 81 - Lok Sabha).

question: Q.293. To whom is the Council of Ministers collectively responsible? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Lok Sabha ', '(b) Parliament ', '(c) Both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha ', '(d) President of India ']
solution: Sol.293.(a) Lok Sabha. Article 74 (deals with the status of the council of ministers), Article 79 (There shall be a Parliament), Article 80 (Rajya Sabha), Article 81 (Lok Sabha). Important Article - Impeachment of President (Article 61), Disqualifications for m embership ( Article 102), Right of President to address and send messages to Houses (Article 86).

question: Q.294. Which of the following states has two houses in its state legislature? SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Gujarat ', '(b) Maharashtra ', '(c) Rajasthan ', '(d) Jharkhand ']
solution: Sol.294.(b) Maharashtra . 6 out of 28 states have bicameral legislatures: Andhra Pradesh (Seats- 58) , Bihar (75), Karnataka (75), Maharashtra (78), Telangana (40), and Uttar Pradesh (100).

question: Q.295. The state legislative assembly has a strength of ____, with exceptions for smaller states. SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.295.(b) 60 and 500 members . However an exception may be granted in the states of Goa, Sikkim, Mizoram, and the union territory of Puducherry which have fewer than 60 members. Maximum seats (Uttar Pradesh; 403) and least number of seats (Puducherry; 30).

question: Q.296. According to the Indian Constitution, the House of People shall consist of n ot more than ______ members to represent the Union territories. SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) thirty ', '(b) twenty ', '(c) fifteen ', '(d) Thirty-five ']
solution: Sol.296.(b) Twenty . The Lok Sabha is composed of representatives of people chosen by direct election on the basis of adult suffrage. T he maximum s trength of the House envisaged by the Constitution is now 550 (530 members to represent States, 20 to represent Union Territories)

question: Q.297. How many organs of g overnment are there according to the Indian Constitution? SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Two ', '(b) Four ', '(c) One ', '(d) Three ']
solution: Sol.297.(d) Three Organs: the Legislature consists of t he President and two Houses, known as Council of States (Rajya Sabha) and House of the People (Lok Sabha), the Executive consists of the President, the Vice-President, and the Council of Ministers with the Prime Minister as the head to aid and advise the President. and the Judiciary consists of the Supreme Court, High Court, District Court or Subordinate Court.

question: Q.298. _____________ is a motion moved by a member to cut s hort the debate on a matter before the House. SSC MTS 13/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Closure ', '(b) No-Confidence ', '(c) Privilege ', '(d) Censure ']
solution: Sol.298.(a) ‘Closure Motion’ . No Confidence Motion’ also called as Motion of No Confidence: A Vote of No Confidence is a formal proposal in Lok Sabha to evoke a decision of the house.

question: Q.299. According to the Indian Constitution, what is the tenure of the members of t he State Legislative Council in India? SSC MTS 14/07/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) 10 years ', '(b) 3 years ', '(c) 4 years ', '(d) 6 years ']
solution: Sol.299.(d) 6 years. It is a permanent body and is not subject to dissolution. The tenure of a Member of the Legislative Council (MLC) is six years, with one-third of the members retiring every two years.

question: Q.300. Who has the power to abolish or create a legislative council in the state? SSC MTS 18/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Parliament ', '(b) High court of the concerned State ', '(c) President ', '(d) Chief minister of the concerned state ']
solution: Sol.300.(a) Parliament. According to the Article 169 of the Constitution of India, the Parliament of India can create or abolish the State Legislative Council of a state if that state's legislature passes a resolution for that with a special majority.

question: Q.301. Which of the following is NOT a feature of parliamentary government in India? SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Membership of the ministers in the legislature, ', '(b) Undissolvable lower house ', '(c) Presence of nominal and real executives ', '(d) Collective responsibility of the executive to the legislature ']
solution: Sol.301.(b) Undissolvable lower house. Features of Parliamentary Government : Nominal and Real Executives, Double Membership, Collective Responsibility, Secrecy of procedure, Prime Ministerial Leadership, Majority Party Rule, Bicameral Legislature, Political Homogeneity, No fixed term.

question: Q.302. An alliance formed by political parties after elections when no party has been able to get adequate seats to form a clear majority is called_____. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) coalition ', '(b) appropriation ', '(c) allegiance ', '(d) prorogation ']
solution: Sol.302.(a) A coalition government is a form of government in which political parties cooperate to form a government. Appropriation is when money is set aside for a specific and particular purpose or purposes. Prorogation means the termination of a session of t he House by an order made by the President under Article 85(2)(a) of the Constitution. Allegiance, the tie that binds an individual to another individual or institution.

question: Q.303. The period between prorogation of Parliament and re-assembly in a new session is called______. SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) adjournment ', '(b) recess ', '(c) dissolution ', '(d) cut motion ']
solution: Sol.303.(b) Recess . An adjournment suspends the work in a sitting for a specified time, which m ay be hours, days or weeks. A dissolution ends the very life of the existing House, and a new House is constituted after general elections are held. Cut motion is a power given to the members of the Lok Sabha that enables its members to oppose any demand in a Finance Bill proposed by a government

question: Q.304. In the absence of t he Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of Lok Sabha, who presides over the joint sitting of the two houses of Parliament? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Chairman of Rajya Sabha ', '(b) Any senior member of Rajya Sabha ', '(c) Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha ', '(d) Any senior member of Lok Sabha ']
solution: Sol.304.(c) Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha . Article 93 - The Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the House of the People . Article 95 - Power of t he Deputy Speaker or other person to perform the duties of the office of, or to act as, Speaker. Article 96 - The Speaker or the Deputy Speaker not to preside while a resolution for his removal from office is under consideration.

question: Q.305. How many seats of Rajya Sabha are present in the state of Maharashtra? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.305.(a) 19 seats elected in Maharashtra and they are indirectly elected by the state legislators of Maharashtra. The fourth Schedule contains the provisions in relation to the allocation of seats for States and Union Territories in the Rajya Sabha. Article 80: Composition of the Council of States.

question: Q.306. The salary and allowances of leaders of opposition in parliament are governed by the Act passed for the first time by the parliament in the year ______. SSC CGL 20/04/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.306.(c) 1977 . Second Schedule of the Indian Constitution deals with the provisions in relation to allowances, privileges, emoluments of : The President of India, Governors of Indian States, Speaker of Lok Sabha & Deputy Speaker of Lok Sabha etc. The leader of the largest Opposition party having not less than one-tenth of the seats of the total strength of the House is recognized as t he leader of the Opposition in that House opposition cabinet.

question: Q.307. The Speaker of the House of the People may submit his resignation to the: SSC MTS 18/10/2021 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Deputy Speaker of the House of the People ', '(b) President ', '(c) Prime Minister ', '(d) Vice-President ']
answer: (a) Deputy Speaker of the House of the People
solution: Sol.307.(a) Deputy Speaker . As per Article 93 of the Indian Constitution, the Lok Sabha has a Speaker and a Deputy Speaker.

question: Q.308. In the Lok Sabha, discussion under which rule of the Constitution of India does not involve a formal motion before the House? SSC MTS 26/10/2021 (Morning)
solution: Sol.308.(b) Rule 193 - Notice for raising discussion. Rule 123- Consideration of amendments made by Council . Rule 146- Procedure on motion for consideration being carried . Rule 157- Voting on motions .

question: Q.309. Who among the following appoints the Speaker 'Pro tem' of t he Lok Sabha? SSC CGL 23/08/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Prime Minister ', '(b) Chief Justice of Supreme Court ', '(c) President ', '(d) Chief Election Commissioner ']
solution: Sol.309.(c) President . He is a temporary speaker appointed for a limited period of time to conduct the works in the Lower House of Parliament after the General elections.

question: Q.310. The process of impeachment of the President of India can be initiated in: SSC CHSL 18/03/2020 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Rajya Sabha but not in Lok Sabha ', '(b) Either house of the parliament ', '(c) Lok Sabha but not in Rajya Sabha ', '(d) Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha or any state legislative assembly ']
solution: Sol.310.(b) Either house of the Parliament. Under Article 61: The President can be removed from office b y a process of impeachment for ‘violation of the Constitution’. These charges should be signed by one-fourth of members of the House (that framed the charges), and a 14 days’ notice should be given to the President. No President has so far been impeached. President, Vice President and Prime Minister

question: Q.311. Who was the second vice-President of India? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023
options: ['(a) VV Giri ', '(b) Krishna Kant ', '(c) Dr Zakir Hussain ', '(d) Dr S Radhakrishnan ']
solution: Sol.311.(c) Dr Zakir Hussain (1962 -1967) - He was the third President of India from 1967-1969, and the first Indian President to die in office i n 1969. He was awarded Bharat Ratna in 1963. First five vice presidents of India : First - Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan (1952-1962). Third - Sh. V.V. Giri (1967-1969). Fourth - Sh. Gopal Swarup Pathak (1969-1974). Fifth - Sh. B.D.Jatti (1974-1979).

question: Q.312. Who will cause every year, annual financial statements to be laid before the Legislative Assembly of the State? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) President ', '(b) Governor ', '(c) Deputy Chief Minister ', '(d) Chief Minister ']
solution: Sol.312.(b) Governor: F inancial Powers - Money bill can only be introduced in the state legislature on his prior recommendation. No demand for grant can be made except on his recommendation. Money from the contingency fund can be withdrawn after his recommendation for meeting the unforeseen expenditures. He constitutes a finance commission for every 5 years to review the financial situation of municipalities and panchayats. Article 112 - Annual financial statement. Article 200 - Assent to Bills.

question: Q.313. Who among the following has given extraordinary powers during an emergency? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Prime Minister ', '(b) The President ', '(c) The Chief Justice ', '(d) The Governor ']
solution: Sol.313.(b) The President. The President of India is empowered to proclaim three types of emergencies to handle extraordinary situations in the country. National Emergency (Article 352), State Emergency or President rule (Article 356), Financial Emergency (Article 360). The President can proclaim National Emergency only after receiving a written recommendation from the cabinet.

question: Q.314. A Governor shall, notwithstanding the expiration of his term, continue to hold office until ______________. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) the President’s consent ', '(b) the Legislative Secretary takes charge ', '(c) he/she has aid and advice of the Chief Minister ', '(d) his/her successor enters his/her office ']
solution: Sol.314.(d) Governor - He is the constitutional head of the state, bound by the advice of the council of m inisters. He functions as a vital link between the Union Government and the State Government. Article 156 - It deals with the term of office of a governor. A governor must: Be a citizen of India, Be at least 35 years of age, Not be a member of either the house of the parliament or the house of the state legislature, Not hold any office of profit.

question: Q.315. Which of the following Articles of the Indian Constitution deals with the relationship between the Prime Minister and the President? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Article 35 ', '(b) Article 25 ', '(c) Article 75 ', '(d) Article 45 ']
solution: Sol.315.(c) Article 75. Article 35 - It lays down that the power to make laws, to give effect to certain specified fundamental rights, shall vest only in the Parliament and not in the state legislatures. Article 25 - It guarantees the freedom of conscience, the freedom to profess, practice, and propagate religion to all citizens.

question: Q.316. When the President of India keeps a bill (except money bill and constitutional amendment bill) pending for an indefinite period, it is called______. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) absolute veto of the President ', '(b) amendatory veto of the President ', '(c) pocket veto of the President ', '(d) suspensive veto of the President ']
solution: Sol.316.(c) Pocket veto of the President. Veto Power of the President of India is guided by Article 111. Three types of Veto Power: Absolute veto, Suspensive veto and Pocket veto. Absolute Veto: It refers to the power of the President to withhold his assent to a bill passed by the Parliament. The bill then ends and does not become an act. Suspensive Veto: The President uses a suspensive veto when he returns the bill to the Indian Parliament for its reconsideration.

question: Q.317. The President of I ndia decides on the question as to the disqualification of Members of Parliament in consultation with the ____________. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Vice President ', '(b) Supreme Court of India ', '(c) Parliament ', '(d) Election Commission of India ']
solution: Sol.317.(d) Election Commission of India. Article 103 - It deals with the decisions of disqualifications of members of Parliament. It provides that the president shall obtain the opinion of the Election Commission and act according to such o pinion. Article 102 - It provides for Disqualification for membership of Parliament If he holds any office of profit, unsound mind, undischarged insolvent, Not a citizen of India. Other provisions: Anti-Defections (10 t h Schedule), Section 8 of Representation of People Act 1951, and Section 499 and 500 of Indian Penal Code.

question: Q.318. Which Article of the Indian Constitution lays the condition that the President, once elected, shall NOT be a member of either the House of Parliament or state legislature? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Article 79 ', '(b) Article 80 ', '(c) Article 62 ', '(d) Article 59 ']
solution: Sol.318.(d) Article 59. Article 79 - There shall be a Parliament for the Union which shall consist of the President and two Houses to be known respectively as the Council of States and the House of the People. Article 80 - Composition of the Council of S tates. Article 62 - Time of holding election to fill vacancy in the office of President and the term o f o ffice of person elected to fill casual vacancy.

question: Q.319. Under which Article of the Indian Constitution shall the executive power of the Union be vested in the President ? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Article 55 ', '(b) Article 56 ', '(c) Article 53 ', '(d) Article 58 ']
solution: Sol.319.(c) Article 53. Other Articles: Article 55 - Manner of election of President. Article 56 - Term of office of President (5 y ears). Article 58 - Qualifications for election as President. Article 57 - Eligibility for re-election. Article 59 - Conditions of the President's office. Article 60 - Oath or affirmation by the President. Article 61 - Procedure for impeachment of the President.

question: Q.320. Whose prior recommendation is required to introduce money bills in state legislature? SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Speaker of the House ', '(b) Chief Minister ', '(c) Governor ', '(d) Advocate General ']
solution: Sol.320.(c) Governor: Appointed by the President. Article 153 - Governors of States. A governor must be at least 35 years of age. Articles related to Money Bill: Article 110 - Concerned with financial matters like taxation, public expenditure, etc. Article 198 - It shall be introduced only in a Legislative Assembly, not in Legislative council.

question: Q.321. Who nominates members to the Rajya Sabha based on their excellence in literature, science, art and social service ? SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) The Chief Justice of India ', '(b) The President ', '(c) The Chairman of the Rajya Sabha ', '(d) The Prime Minister ']
solution: Sol.321.(b) The President. He is the nominal executive authority of India.The Rajya Sabha s hall have 250 members o ut of which 238 represents the state and union territories, and 12 members shall be nominated by the President who h ave special knowledge of Art, Science, Literature and Social Sciences. Fourth Schedule - Allocation of seats in the Council of States (Rajya Sabha).

question: Q.322. Who was our first Prime Minister? SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Rajendra Prasad ', '(b) Indira Gandhi ', '(c) Jawaharlal Nehru ', '(d) Gulzarilal Nanda ']
solution: Sol.322.(c) Jawahar Lal Nehru. First in India : Deputy Prime Minister - Vallabh Bhai Patel, Women Prime Minister - Indira Gandhi, Women President - Pratibha Patil, Women Chief Minister - Sucheta Kripalani (Uttar Pradesh), Women Lok Sabha Speaker - Meira Kumar (15th Lok Sabha).

question: Q.323. What is the tenure of the Vice-President of India? SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Until the age of 65 ( b) Until he wants to hold the office (c) 6 years (d) 5 years Sol.323.(d) 5 y ears. Vice p resident is the second highest constitutional office in India. Article 63 - Vice P resident of I ndia. The Vice-President of India is elected indirectly by members ( elected as well as nominated) of Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. Article 89 - The Vice President presides over the meetings of t he council of states.', '', '', '']

question: Q.324. Who was the Prime Minister of India when the Fundamental Duties were first incorporated in the Constitution of India? SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Jawaharlal Nehru ', '(b) Indira Gandhi ', '(c) Atal Bihari Vajpayee ', '(d) Rajiv Gandhi ']
solution: Sol.324.(b) Indira Gandhi : 3rd Prime Minister of India and first and, to date, only female prime minister of India.

question: Q.325. Who holds the authority of transferring judges from one High court to another High Court? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) The senior most judge of Supreme Court ', '(b) The chief justice of india ', '(c) The president of india ', '(d) The law minister of india ']
solution: Sol.325.(c) The President of India (Article 52). Article 222 - Transfer of a Judge from one High Court to another. Article 217 -Appointment and conditions of the office of a Judge of a High Court. Article 124 - Establishment and constitution of the Supreme Court. Article 218 - Application of certain provisions relating to the Supreme Court to High Courts. Article 214 - High Courts for States.

question: Q.326. Which of the following statements are correct regarding removal of the President of India? A. The impeachment process can be initiated in either House of Parliament. B. The impeachment charges must be signed by the one-third members of the House in which the process is initiated. C. In the impeachment process, a 30 days' notice should be given to the President. D. The impeachment resolution is passed by a majority of two-thirds of the total membership of that House. SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) B and C only ', '(b) A, B and C only ', '(c) A, B, C and D ', '(d) A and D only ']
solution: Sol.326.(d) A and D only. Article 61: Procedure for impeachment of the President. The impeachment charges must be signed by not less than one-fourth members of the house in which the process is initiated. A fourteen day notice should be given to the president. Impeachment of the President was taken from the US Constitution.

question: Q.327. Who administers oath of o ffice t o the Vice President of India? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) The Prime Minister of India ', '(b) The Speaker of Lok Sabha ', '(c) The President of India ', '(d) The Chief Justice of India ']
solution: Sol.327.(c) The President of India. Article 69 - Oath or affirmation b y the Vice-President. He is the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha. Some other Oaths administered by the President: Prime Minister, Council of Ministers, Chief Justice of India.

question: Q.328. Which of the following statements are correct regarding the State Executive ? A. Article 152 of the Indian Constitution states 'Unless the context otherwise requires, the expression 'State' does not include Jammu and Kashmir'. B. The 7th Constitutional Amendment Act has provided for the appointment of the same person as Governor for two or more states. C. The Supreme Court clearly mentioned that the office of the Governor is under the control of the Central Government. SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) B and C only ', '(b) A and C only ', '(c) A, B and C ', '(d) A and B only ']
solution: Sol.328.(d) A and B only. Part VI of Constitution (functioning of state government). Articles under Part VI : Article 153 - Governors of a state, Article 154 - Executive power of t he state, Article 155 - Appointment of governor, Article 156 - Terms of office of governor, Article 159 - Oath or affirmation by the governor, Article 163 - Council of ministers to aid and advise governor, Article 165 - Advocate general for the state, Article 166 - Conduct of business of the government of a state , Article 170 - Composition of the legislative assemblies

question: Q.329. Who, being the Commander - in - Chief of the Indian Armed Forces, takes the salute of different regiments of the armed forces during the march-past on Republic Day? SSC CGL 25/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) The Defence Minister of India ', '(b) The Prime Minister of India ', '(c) The Home Minister of India ', '(d) The President of India ']
solution: Sol.329.(d) President of India: - The head of the state and he is the first citizen of India. Powers of President: He appoints attorney general of India (Article 76), Comptroller and Auditor General of India (Article 148), He deals with 3 types of emergencies in Part XVIII National Emergency (Article 352), President’s Rule (Article 356 & 365), Financial E mergency (Article 360). Article 123 - Power of the President to promulgate Ordinances during recess of Parliament.

question: Q.330. The Governor of an Indian state before entering upon his office takes an oath or affirmation before ____________. SSC CGL 25/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) the Chief Justice of the High Court exercising jurisdiction in relation to the State ', '(b) the President of India ', '(c) the Chief Minister of the concerned state ', '(d) the Prime Minister of India ']
answer: (a) the Chief Justice of the High Court exercising jurisdiction in relation to the State
solution: Sol.330.(a) Article 159 - Oath or affirmation to the Governor by the Chief Justice of the High Court and in his Absence, senior most Judge of that Court available. Article 155 - The Governor of a State shall be appointed by the President. Article 153 - Governors of States.

question: Q.331. What is the duty of the Chief Minister, as mentioned under Article 167 of the Indian Constitution? SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Communication of all decisions of the Council of Ministers to the Governor. ', '(b) Appointment and removal of Council of the Ministers. ', '(c) Appointment of the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly. ', '(d) Appointment of Advocate General of the state in consultation with Attorney general. ']
answer: (a) Communication of all decisions of the Council of Ministers to the Governor.
solution: Sol.331.(a) Article 167 imposes on the Chief Minister the responsibility of keeping the Governor informed of all decisions made by the Council of Ministers concerning administration and legislation. Article 178 - It deals with the corresponding position for Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Legislative Assembly of a state. Article 165 - Related to the office of t he Advocate General for the States who is the highest law officer in the State.

question: Q.332. Who among the following served the shortest tenure as the Prime Minister of India ? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) HD Deva Gowda ', '(b) VP Singh ', '(c) Chandra Shekhar ', '(d) IK Gujral ']
solution: Sol.332.(c) Chandra Shekhar. Shri Gulzari Lal Nanda (11 January 1966 - 24 January 1966 and 27 May 1964 - 9 June 1964) served the shortest tenure as PM. H D D eva Gowda (June 1, 1996 - April 2 1, 1997) - 11th Prime Minister of I ndia. V. P. Singh (December 2, 1989 - November 10, 1990) - 7th Prime Minister of India. Chandra Shekhar (10 November 1990 and 21 June 1991) - 8th Prime Minister of India. The longest-serving prime minister was J awaharlal Nehru, ( 16 years and 286 days).

question: Q.333. There shall be a ___________ with the Prime Minister at the head to aid and advise the President of India. Higher Secondary 30/06/2023 (Shift - 2)
options: ['(a) Council of States ', '(b) Council of Ministers ', '(c) Advocate General ', '(d) Attorney General for India ']
solution: Sol.333.(b) Council of Ministers. Article 74 - Council of Ministers. The advice tendered by Ministers to the President shall not be inquired into in any court. Total number of ministers in the COM - 15% of the Lok Sabha ( Mandated by 91st Amendment Act of 2003).

question: Q.334. The President of India shall be elected by the members of an electoral college consisting of: SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Morning) I. The elected members of both Houses of Parliament. II.The elected members of the Legislative Assemblies of the States.
options: ['(a) Both I and II ', '(b) Only I ', '(c) Neither I nor II ', '(d) Only II ']
solution: Sol.334.(a) Both I and II. The President (Articles 52-62) : Article 52 - The President of India. Article 53 - The executive power of t he Union. A rticle 54 - Election of President. Article 55 -Manner of election of P resident. Article 56 - Term of office of President. Article 58 - Qualifications for election as President. Article 60 - Oath or affirmation by the President. Article 61 - Procedure for impeachment of the President.

question: Q.335. The Inter-State Council consists of ______ ministers of Cabinet rank in the Union Council of Ministers nominated by the Prime Minister of India. SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) six ', '(b) two ', '(c) ten ', '(d) four ']
solution: Sol.335.(a) Six. Inter-State Council - A constitutional body established by the President of India. Article 263 contemplates the establishment of an inter-state council to effect coordination between the states and between centre and states. Established by the President of India. Composition of t he council - PM as chairman, CM of all the states and UTS having legislative assemblies, Administrators of UTs not having legislative assemblies, Governors of states under President’s rule, Five ministers of the cabinet rank are permanent invitees of the council.

question: Q.336. Which Article of the Indian constitution talks about Oath or affirmation by the President? SSC MTS 08/05/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Article 72 ', '(b) Article 60 ', '(c) Article 45 ', '(d) Article 56 ']
solution: Sol.336.(b) Article 60. It states that the oath of office to the President is administered by the Chief Justice of India. Article 72 - It empowers the President to grant pardons to persons. Article 45 - The State shall endeavour to provide early childhood care and education to children below the age of six years. Article 56 - The President shall hold office for a term of five years from the date he takes up his post.

question: Q.337. W ho appoints the Chief Justice of India? SSC MTS 12/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Vice - President ', '(b) President ', '(c) Supreme Court Judge ', '(d) Prime Minister ']
solution: Sol.337.(b) President. Article 124 (2) - Vests power on the President to appoint every Judge of the Supreme Court including the Chief Justice of India. Article 124 - States the establishment of the Supreme Court. Article 124 (3) - Qualification of Supreme court Judge. Q.338 . What is the minimum age (in years) a person should be if he/she is willing to be appointed as the Governor of a state in India ? SSC MTS 19/05/2023 (Afternoon) (a) 28 (b) 30 (c) 35 (d) 40 Sol.338.(c) 35 years. Article 157 - Qualifications for appointment as Governor (must be a citizen of India and must have completed 35 years of age). Article 153 - Governors of S tates. Article 154 - Executive power of State. Article 155 - Appointment of Governor. A rticle 58 - The presidential candidate must complete the age of 35 years. Article 84 (b) - the minimum age for Lok Sabha election shall be 25 years.

question: Q.339. Who administers the Union Territories of India? SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) President ', '(b) Prime Minister ', '(c) Chief Minister ', '(d) Member of Legislative Assembly ']
solution: Sol.339.(a) President. The administrator appointed by the President runs the administration on the behalf of the President. Part - VIII (Union Territories), Article 239 (Administration of Union territories). Article 239A (Creation of local legislatures or council of ministers or both for certain Union territories. Example (Pondicherry). Article 239AA (Special provisions with respect to Delhi).

question: Q.340. Which of the following statements are correct regarding the benefits of the retired President of India? A. The former President of India will also be entitled to a monthly pension of ₹2.5 lakh. B. He/She is entitled to a secretarial staff comprising a private secretary, a personal assistant, an additional private secretary, two peons, and office expenses up to ₹1 lakh per annum. C. He/She is also entitled to free highest-class travel anywhere in India, accompanied by one person, by rail, air, or steamer. SSC CGL Tier II (02/03/2023)
options: ['(a) A and B only ', '(b) B and C only ', '(c) A and C only ', '(d) A, B and C ']
solution: Sol.340.(d) A, B and C. The President {Article (52-62)} of India is the head of state of the Republic of India. First President - Rajendra Prasad (held office for two terms, longest serving president of India). Article 54 - Election of President, Article 60- Oath or affirmation by the President. Article 61- Procedure for impeachment of the President.

question: Q.341. Who among the following Presidents of India was also the deputy chairman of the Planning Commission? SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) VV Giri ', '(b) KR Narayanan ', '(c) Ramaswamy Venkataraman ', '(d) Pranab Mukherjee ']
solution: Sol.341.(d) Dr. Pranab Mukherjee (13th president). Other positions he hold were Minister of Finance (2009 - 2012), Minister of Defence (2004 - 2006), Minister of E xternal Affairs ( 2006 - 2009), 15th Leader of the Lok Sabha (2004 – 2012), Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission (1991 - 1996), 14th Leader of the Rajya Sabha (1980 – 1984), Member of Parliament, Lok Sabha (2004 - 2012), and Member of P arliament, Rajya Sabha (1969 - 1981). V.V Giri (4th President), K.R Narayan (10th president). Ramaswamy Venkataraman (8th president).

question: Q.342. Which of the following statements about the Vice President of India is INCORRECT? SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Members of State legislatures do not take part in his elections. ', '(b) He acts as the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha. ', '(c) The Vice President is elected for five years. ', '(d) He can be removed from his office by the President approved through a resolution passed by the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. ']
answer: (d) He can be removed from his office by the President approved through a resolution passed by the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha.
solution: Sol.342.(d) Vice president of India: The vice president is elected for five years. Minimum age: 35. He acts as the ex-officio chairman o f t he Rajya s abha. In the electoral college for Vice President, both elected and nominated members o f both the Houses of Parliament take part. Members of the State Legislature do n ot participate in the election of the Vice President.

question: Q.343. The system based on individual leadership is a __________ system . SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) semi-parliamentary ', '(b) parliamentary ', '(c) presidential ', '(d)semi-presidential ']
solution: Sol.343.(c) Presidential. A presidential system is one in which t he head of s tate is also the head of government, and the executive branch is independent of the legislative branch. Parliamentary system is a form of government where executives hold the power with the majority support of the legislature. A semi-presidential system is a republican system of governance that c ombines elements of presidential democracy with parliamentary democracy.

question: Q.344. Which is NOT correct about the President of India? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) The President holds office for a period of five years. ', '(b) He is a part of the Parliament. ', '(c) Every bill passed by the Parliament goes to the President for his assent before it becomes a law. ', '(d) He has veto power by which he can withhold or refuse to give assent to Bills including Money Bill passed by the Parliament. ']
answer: (d) He has veto power by which he can withhold or refuse to give assent to Bills including Money Bill passed by the Parliament.
solution: Sol.344.(d) The President of India (Articles 52-62) is the first citizen of India. He is the head of state of the Republic of India. He is the formal head of the executive, legislature and judiciary of India and is also the commander -in -chief of the Indian Armed Forces. Rajendra Prasad, the first president of India, is the only person to have held office for two terms.

question: Q.345. The emoluments and allowances of the President and other expenditure relating to his office is charged on the ______ of India. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) contingency fund ', '(b) estimates fund ', '(c) consolidated fund ', '(d) public accounts fund ']
solution: Sol.345.(c) Consolidated Funds - Article 266(1). Three types of funds of the Central Government – Consolidated Fund of India - Revenues received by the government and expenses made by it, excluding the exceptional items. Contingency Fund of India (Article 267) - the emergency fund for the nation and Public Accounts of India (Article 266(2) - those funds that are received on behalf of the Government of India.

question: Q.346. Which is NOT correct about the powers of the Chief Minister? Graduate Level 04/08/2022 (Shift - 2)
options: ['(a) He allocates portfolios among ministers. ', '(b) He presides over the meetings of the Council of Ministers. ', '(c) When he resigns or dies, it has no effect in the functioning of the council of ministers. ', '(d) The Governor appoints ministers on His recommendations. ']
answer: (c) When he resigns or dies, it has no effect in the functioning of the council of ministers.
solution: Sol.346.(c) The Governor appoints the Chief Minister and other Ministers (Article 164). The Chief Minister is the head of the State Council of Ministers and the real executive head of state government. Article 167 (Chief Minister acts as a link between Governor and state council of ministers).

question: Q.347. Who among the following is NOT appointed by the President of India? Graduate Level 05/08/2022 (Shift - 3)
options: ['(a) Ambassadors and High Commissioners ', '(b) Comptroller and Auditor General of India ', '(c) Attorney General of India ', '(d) Solicitor General of India ']
solution: Sol.347.(d) Solicitor General of India (the second - highest law officer of the country) is appointed by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC). Attorney Generals of I ndia (Article 76). Comptroller and Auditor General of India (Article 148).

question: Q.348. According to the Constitution of India, the executive power of the state shall be vested in the______. SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) President of India ', '(b) Governor of the state ', '(c) Chief Minister of the state ', '(d) Advocate-General of the state ']
solution: Sol.348.(b) Governor of the state. According to Article 154 of the Indian Constitution, the executive power of the State shall be vested in the Governor and shall be exercised by him either directly or through officers subordinate to him. Similarly According to Article 53, the executive power of the Union shall be vested in the President.

question: Q.349. A candidate seeking election as Vice-President is required to make a security deposit of _____. SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.349.(d) ₹15,000. The post of Vice-President (Article 63 to Article 71; Part V) is the ex-officio chairman of the Rajya Sabha. He should be a citizen of India, have completed the age of thirty-five years, and be qualified for election as a member of the Council of States.

question: Q.350. Who a mong the following was t he third Vice - President of India? SSC CHSL 02/06/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) BD Jatti ', '(b) Zakir Hussain ', '(c) Gopal Swarup Pathak ', '(d) V. V. Giri ']
solution: Sol.350.(d) V. V. Giri. Vice Presidents of India - 1st Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, 2nd- Zakir Hussain, 4th Gopal Swarup Pathak, 5th B D Jatti. 14th- Jagdeep Dhankhan.

question: Q.351. The election of the next Vice-President is to be held within _____ of the expiry of the term of office of the outgoing Vice-President. SSC CHSL 02/06/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) 90 days ', '(b) 60 days ', '(c) 120 days ', '(d) 75 days ']
solution: Sol.351.(b) 60 days . Article 66 of the Constitution of India states the manner of election of the vice president.

question: Q.352. Who among the following is the 'Visitor' to all central universities of India? SSC MTS 14/10/2021 (Evening)
options: ['(a) President of India ', '(b) Chairman, University Grants Commission ', '(c) Union Minister of Human Resources Development ', '(d) Vice - President of India ']
solution: Sol.352.(a) President of India is the 'Visitor' to all central universities of I ndia. According to Article 52 of the Constitution of India, the President is the head of state of the Republic of India.

question: Q.353. Who among the following replaced Morarji Desai as the Prime Minister of India in 1979? SSC CGL 13/08/2021 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Chandrasekhar ', '(b) Devi Lal ', '(c) Jagjivan Ram ', '(d) Charan Singh ']
solution: Sol.353.(d) Charan Singh replaced Morarji Desai as the Prime Minister of India in 1979. Morarji Desai was the 4th Prime Minister of India and served between 1977 and 1979. He was India's first non-Congress PM Charan Singh was further replaced by Indira Gandhi.

question: Q.354. Which Indian president used the pocket veto for the Indian Post Office (Amendment) Bill, 1986? SSC CHSL 19/04/2021 (Evening)
options: ['(a) APJ Abdul Kalam ', '(b) KR Narayanan ', '(c) Giani Zail Singh ', '(d) Dr Rajendra Prasad ']
solution: Sol.354.(c) Giani Zail Singh used the pocket veto for the Indian Post Office (Amendment) Bill, 1986. In Pocket veto, the bill is kept pending by the President for a n indefinite period. He neither rejects the bill nor returns the bill for reconsideration. Judiciary

question: Q.355. Disputes between two or more states come under the _______ of the Supreme Court. SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) original jurisdiction ', '(b) advisory jurisdiction ', '(c) Appellate Jurisdiction ', '(d) writ jurisdiction ']
solution: Sol.355.(a) Original jurisdiction - The power to hear and determine a dispute in the first instance. It is provided under Article 131 of the Indian Constitution. Article 143 of the Indian Constitution confers upon the Supreme Court advisory jurisdiction. Article 133 - Appellate jurisdiction of Supreme Court in appeals from High Courts in regard to civil matters.

question: Q.356. By which of the following writs the Supreme Court and the High Courts may call for the record of a case from a lower court on an allegation of a n excess of jurisdiction ? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Certiorari ', '(b) Prohibition ', '(c) Mandamus ', '(d) Habeas Corpus ']
solution: Sol.356.(a) Certiorari. Writs in India: Habeas Corpus - To produce a person before the court to determine whether their detention is lawful. Mandamus - To direct a public official or authority to perform a public duty. Prohibition - To prohibit a public official or authority from doing something that they are not allowed to do. Quo Warranto - To challenge the right of a person to hold a public office.

question: Q.357. In which of the following cases the Supreme Court, while laying out the 'basic structure' of the Constitution held that the democratic character of the polity was a n essential component of t he 'basic structure" ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Romesh Thappar vs State of Madras ', '(b) AK Gopalan vs State of Madras ', '(c) Kesavananda Bharati vs State of Kerala ', '(d) Sajjan Singh vs State of Rajasthan ']
answer: (c) Kesavananda Bharati vs State of Kerala
solution: Sol.357.(c) This judgement was delivered on 24 April 1 973.
